RORSettlementTemplate.MenuHeaderText: The town is home to the Deathjacks, an infamous and deadly archer regiment of renown.
Within the town you find a barrack of the Stir River Patrol, it has seen constant use and houses weary patrolmen.
Within the town there is a Chapter House of the Knights of the Blazing Sun.
The town is home to the Von Kragsburg Guard. Their barracks are ornate, ordered and clean.
Within the town, you may find the Imperial Gunnery School. It is a sprawling network of forges, smelteries and factories, worked by the Empires Veteran Gunsmiths and Engineers.
The town houses the quarters of Grundel's Defenders. A temporary resting place, spears are lined up against the walls.
Within the town there is a Chapter House of the Blood Dragons.
Near the village, the Forgotten Legion of Castle Sternieste awaits in their crypt, ready to be raised.
Under the town in an ancient crypt, the Konigstein Stalkers await their new master.

The village houses a Longshanks Encampment. Despite their life of constant travel, vowing to never stay anywhere for long, camps like this can still be found when these hardy folk rest their weary legs.
The village houses a Horned Hunter Encampment. Despite deep forays into the woods of Talabecland, travelling far from civilisation to honour Taal, Hunters are seen to pass through this camp to rest.
Home to the renowned and loved Altdorf Company of Honour, the 'Sons of the Reik', only the best may fight alongside these venerable warriors.
Within the great Cathedral of Sigmar, resides the barracks of the Knights Griffon. The deadliest knights within the Empire.
Due to Grünburg's proximity to Castle Reikguard, the headquarters of the Grand Order of the Reiksguard Knights, some of the finest knights of the Empire often patrol these roads.
Around Bergerac, you notice the camp of the famous Bowman of Bergerac.
Inside the Abby of Maisontaal you find the Taal devoted cultists of maisontaal.
The village is home to Geg's Manor. Little more than a shack, it is nevertheless home to the less than regal Peasant Knights of Wainfleet.
Not all Forest Spirits wish to coexist with the Asrai. Malevolent and deranged denizens of the forest are banished to the Wildwood, where elite Willdwood Rangers keep their eternal watch.

Fyr Darric, the Trickster's Wood, holds the largest concentration of Wardancer troupes wandering through Athel Loren. Music and laughter can often be heard in this region, but not all things are as they seem at a glance.
Here, in King's Glade, impulsive Wild Riders, without uttering a word, await the rebirth of their master, Orion. Their only desire is to ride the Wild Hunt at the side of the King in the Woods.
